name: nDeploy
tagline: cpanel nginx plugin that lets you deploy PHP/Ruby/Python/NodeJS/ColdFusion and more!
body:
# nDeploy 
nDeploy enables a cpanel webhost to do application hosting on a shared web hosting server . It is powered by a custom compiled nginX web server . The application lets cpanel users to choose multiple script backends and for each backends the user has the power to choose a number of nginx configurations (profiles).

Following features are currently supported

1. Multiple backends which includes PHP-FPM, RUBY(rack/rails) ,PYTHON (wsgi) , NODEJS(version > 0.10), ColdFusion( Railo deployed on Tomcat/Resin)

2. nginX terminates SSL as well as non-ssl connections .The SSL certificates configured in cPanel is automatically used .SSL configured for maximum security by default.

3. IPv6 support .IPv6 address configured in cPanel is automatically used.

4. nginX compiled with mod_pagespeed , ngx_cache_purge and Phusion Passenger



## INSTALLATION
nDeploy needs a fairly newer cpanel version to work. The script is mostly tested on cpanel version 11.46.0 .It should work on lower versions too.

1.Install EPEL repository 

2.Install nDeploy repository
`rpm -ivh http://rpm.piserve.com/nDeploy-release-centos-1.0-el6.noarch.rpm`
`yum install  nDeploy nginx-nDeploy`

3.Before you start nginx ; enable nDeploy using the command
`/opt/nDeploy/scripts/cpanel-nDeploy-setup.sh enable`

Once you install nDeploy ;nginx starts listening on port 80 and 443 . By default the cpanel-nDeploy-setup script above just adds a PROXY backend which proxies everything to the cpanel apache service and a Ruby backend (required for Phusion Passenger to work) . Server Administrator will need to install additional backends and register them in nDeploy backends.yaml file inorder for users to starting using the different backends.
